title: Book Of Engravings, No title, 1703–70
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description:
Bound book of plates, the first four being various Chinoiserie scenes.  The remaining 7 are scenes of Rococo figures and ornamentation.

Chinoiserie plates:

1. Four chinoise figures on a boat. Text below reads: "Paris Chez Huquier rue S.Jacque au coin de la rue des Mathurnes. Avec privil du roi. Sculp: Aveline Junior.

2. Four chinoiserie figures. One female stands while three youths remain in various poses at her feet.  Sculp: Huquier, rue St. Jacques.

3. A shepherd with his flock.  Sculp: Aveline Junior.

4. A corpulent chinoiserie figure reclines beneath a palm tree. Text below reads: "A Paris Chez Huquier, rue St. Jacques, au coin de la rue des Mathurins. Avec privilige du Roi."

Rococo plates:

1. "Triomphe de Pomone." Sculp: Cochin Filius. Three figs. atop a large escutcheon.
Text below plate reads: "A Paris Chez De Larmessin graveur du Roy, rue des Noyes a la duxienne Porte cochere a gauche entrant par la Rue St Jacques A.P.D.R."

2. "Triomphe de Priape." Sculp: C.L. Duflos. Ten putti frolicking in various poses.
Text below reads: "A Paris Chez de Larmessin graveur du Roy rue des Noyes a la deuxiene Porte cochere a gauche entrant par la rue St. Jacques A.P.D.R.

3.  "Hommage Champetre." Sculp: C.L. Duflos. Two seated figures, 1 male, 1 female. Male is placing a wreath on the young girl's head. Text below reads: "A Paris Chez De Larmessin, graveur du Roy rue des Noyers a la duxienne Porte cochere a gauche entrant par la rue St. Jacques A.P.D.R.

4. "Rocaille." Sculp: Duflos. Depicts various rocaille ornamentation, including coral and shells. 

5. "Leda." Sculp: Duflos. Leda & the Swan sit together beneath Rocaill ornamentation, possibly a fountain? 

6. "La Pesche." Sculp: Le Prince. Text beneath reads: "A Paris Chez Huquier rue des Mathurnes au coin de la rue de Sorbonne. C.P.R."

7. "La Chasse." Sculp: Le Prince. Text beneath reads: "A Paris Chez Huquier rue des Mathurnes au coin de la rue de Sorbonne. C.P.R."

tombstone.epitaph:
Book Of Engravings, No title, 1703–70. 
Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-203
